case.state: $('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Let's see... so this is The Inventory, eh? Spooky. Well not really. Dunno why I said that, to be honest. 'S actually quite nice! And our lives aren't in mortal danger, always a plus!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Careful! Careful, this could be another test. Granted, doesn't look like one... Definitely not sensing any, uh, devious...ness. You know what, let's operate under the assumption that this isn't a test, you know, actually relax for once, and if it is a test, then I'm sure they'll be very happy we played along. Good? Good. Let's go.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Right, let's see here... We've got a table, chairs... cards, we've got cards... Oh, cards! You know what, this is going to sound a little bit crazy, but I think this might be a poker game. Figured that one out myself, just using the old, uh... Sign? Oh, look, there's a sign! Says "poker", right there in big letters. Scary, really, how right I was. So confident, even, I didn't even think to look at the, uh, incredibly obvious sign there.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Look at that! A human! Hey, that could be your ~human.ifMale(father|mother)~!
What? I don't know humans. No models, no registry, you can't tell them apart! Glad they were all, you know, in a database for my old job. Would have mixed them up way more than I did.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Let's see... so this is The Inventory, eh? Spooky. Well not really. Dunno why I said that, to be honest. 'S actually quite nice! And our lives aren't in mortal danger, always a plus!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Careful! Careful, this could be another test. Granted, doesn't look like one... Definitely not sensing any, uh, devious...ness. You know what, let's operate under the assumption that this isn't a test, you know, actually relax for once, and if it is a test, then I'm sure they'll be very happy we played along. Good? Good. Let's go.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Right, let's see here... We've got a table, chairs... cards, we've got cards... Oh, cards! You know what, this is going to sound a little bit crazy, but I think this might be a poker game. Figured that one out myself, just using the old, uh... Sign? Oh, look, there's a sign! Says "poker", right there in big letters. Scary, really, how right I was. So confident, even, I didn't even think to look at the, uh, incredibly obvious sign there.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Look at that! A human! Hey, that could be your ~human.ifMale(father|mother)~!
What? I don't know humans. No models, no registry, you can't tell them apart! Glad they were all, you know, in a database for my old job. Would have mixed them up way more than I did.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');document.getElementById("ddlalert").onclick = function() {document.getElementById("ddlalert").style.display = "none"};[Click to close]
Chell features Mouseover Dialogue! Hover over the dialogue to bring it over Chell's image.Let's see... so this is The Inventory, eh? Spooky. Well not really. Dunno why I said that, to be honest. 'S actually quite nice! And our lives aren't in mortal danger, always a plus!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');document.getElementById("ddlalert").onclick = function() {document.getElementById("ddlalert").style.display = "none"};[Click to close] Chell features Mouseover Dialogue! Hover over the dialogue to bring it over Chell's image.Careful! Careful, this could be another test. Granted, doesn't look like one... Definitely not sensing any, uh, devious...ness. You know what, let's operate under the assumption that this isn't a test, you know, actually relax for once, and if it is a test, then I'm sure they'll be very happy we played along. Good? Good. Let's go.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');document.getElementById("ddlalert").onclick = function() {document.getElementById("ddlalert").style.display = "none"};[Click to close] Chell features Mouseover Dialogue! Hover over the dialogue to bring it over Chell's image.Right, let's see here... We've got a table, chairs... cards, we've got cards... Oh, cards! You know what, this is going to sound a little bit crazy, but I think this might be a poker game. Figured that one out myself, just using the old, uh... Sign? Oh, look, there's a sign! Says "poker", right there in big letters. Scary, really, how right I was. So confident, even, I didn't even think to look at the, uh, incredibly obvious sign there.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');document.getElementById("ddlalert").onclick = function() {document.getElementById("ddlalert").style.display = "none"};[Click to close] Chell features Mouseover Dialogue! Hover over the dialogue to bring it over Chell's image.Look at that! A human! Hey, that could be your ~human.ifMale(father|mother)~!
What? I don't know humans. No models, no registry, you can't tell them apart! Glad they were all, you know, in a database for my old job. Would have mixed them up way more than I did.

Oi! She used a portal just then! D'you think... could she have stolen a portal gun? Is that why you didn't bring yours?
No, no. Wouldn't make sense. I personally made sure it was safe. On that cube. In that... that room. That I put it in.
Right, just as a thought, you wouldn't mind if it was stolen, yeah? You can always get another one! I mean, there's no way they don't have extra, for all their tests.

Oh, look at that! Is that... is that you? She is, uh, a bit chubbier around the... face... area. Can't be you though, can it? Must be another test subject! Hello!
...She's just as quiet, isn't she? Course she is.
What--What's that around her waist, there? Looks like... Looks like a bit of a mess, really.
That's... that's a car, there, isn't it? Why is there a bloody car here?!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, look! Another robot! That's... well not a change of pace, really. Not like we're usually surrounded by humans. Nice to know I won't be alone, though. That's a... a plus.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, look! Another robot! That's... well not a change of pace, really. Not like we're usually surrounded by humans. Nice to know I won't be alone, though. That's a... a plus.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Hey! Is that---Ope, nevermnd. You know, I saw a sphere with a coloured light at the front, thought it was another core! Honest mistake, really.
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Is that... It's a bloody butterfly! Is it gonna play the game with us? You can't be serious!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Hah! "Ladybug"? Can't fool me, luv, I've actually seen a ladybug before! Actually, I haven't, come to think of it, but I've heard them described! Close enough.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Now how come she's not called Ladybird? What with the, um... You've got the red... And the--And the dots. Looks just like one! Am I missing something?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Hold on, she just writes what she wants to say down? How come you don't do that?! Seems easy enough, really, all you need is... well, I guess you do need paper. And some kind of... some kind of pen. Haven't seen any pens, come to think of it... Right, I suppose lack of, er, resources, might make that difficult. Makes sense, really. Carry on!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');That's... that's a ghost, isn't it? Hey, are you sure about this? I mean, this is... well, uncharted territory, really. Unprecedented, to say the least.
This isn't normal, right? You're always so indifferent, I can't bloody tell!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, look at that. Books. Loads of them. Would love to read all of them, really. Shame I'm just on this--this cube. Oh, no need to pick me up.
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Out there, in the sky! They look like bridges! Is that where Aperture get them?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Hey, do you, uh... Do you see that? Y'know, out in the sky. Just want to make sure, you know. Make sure it's not a--a visual error.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Are they--You think they're filming us? Well, I suppose that's not that different, you know, from all the cameras back at Aperture. Wonder if it's for the same reason.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh look! Cameras! That should be more comfortable for you, yeah? Just like home! I suppose it's not really a good home, though. What with the constant... threat... of death.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Those... those are ghosts, aren't they? Hey, are you sure about this? I mean, this is... well, uncharted territory, really. Unprecedented, to say the least.
This isn't normal, right? You're always so indifferent, I can't bloody tell!
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Shouldn't... Shouldn't there be curtains? You know, for privacy? Not that you're, er... used to that.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Where are the curtains? Shower curtains are always... nice. Always good. I know Aperture has warehouses full of the the things, anyway. Could bring some back here!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');A mural, eh? Interesting. I mean, not sure why you'd put a bunch of humans on it, but that's to be expected, really. You lot really do love depicting... yourselves. Looking at each other, and all that. Never seen the appeal, really, of, erm, looking at... humans. Sorry, didn't mean to, er... Sorry.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');And off we go!
...
Right then...
You're all like her, then, aren't you? Is this just how humans are? None of you talk? I could have sworn there were some scientists that... that talked. Did you all just lose your vocal cords? Just evolved past them?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, look! More robots! That's... well, not a change of pace, really. Not like we're usually surrounded by humans. Other way round, generally, isn't it? S'pose this won't be much different.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, look! You're not, er, you're not quite human, are you? Let's see... not robot, not human... Right, I give up, what are you, exactly? 'Cause I've never heard of it, whatever it is.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Why's ~gun.ifMale(he|she)~ got a gun?! Gotta watch out there, now, haven't we? Watch out for... for gunfire. Actually, s'pose it'll be obvious when it happens, won't it?
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Look at that! ~drunk.ifMale(He|She)~'s absolutely legless! You think ~drunk.ifMale(he|she)~ can play like that?
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, it's been ages since I talked to humans! I mean, sure, she's here, but she doesn't exactly, er... speak.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');You reckon ~spanish~ speaks Spanish? You may not believe this, but I actually speak a bit myself. Watch this.
Hola, ~spanish.ifMale(amiga|amigo)~! Donde esta, er... Donde esta la biblioteca?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Hold on, what's with ~skin.ifMale(his|her)~ skin? It's all... off! D'you reckon ~skin.ifMale(he|she)~'s got some sort of disease?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');And off we go!
...
Right then...
You're all like her, then, aren't you? Is this just how humans are? None of you talk? I could have sworn there were some scientists that... that talked. Did you all just lose your vocal cords? Just evolved past them?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');And off we go!
...
Right then...
You're all like her, then, aren't you? Is this just how humans are? None of you talk? I could have sworn there were some scientists that... that talked. Did you all just lose your vocal cords? Just evolved past them?
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Now, I'd be careful, here. ~weapon.ifMale(He|She)~ is, er... armed. No telling what ~weapon.ifMale(he|she)~ might do.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Oh, are we starting? I thought---You know, I figured we'd... wait. I thought more people will be coming. No, no, you're right, three's enough.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');I guess we could always relax when we were testing, too. Well, I suppose you couldn't, really, what with all the deadly lasers, and the deadly turrets, and the deadly pits full of deadly... I suppose things were pretty exciting for you. But you always did it! Always with that classic grip of yours. Humans, always so reliable. Until they break down, of course. So hard to repair. Could do with a bit of intelligent design, eh?

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');You do know how to play cards, right? I mean, I've been meaning to learn, but, uh... Anyway, I'm sure you'll get it quickly enough! And I can... I can be moral support!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Y'know what? It's really great that we're here, playing poker. Really fortunate, it is. Not that I know how to play poker, you're on your own there. I mean, heh, I'd hate to be you, having to figure it out while I just sit here, not contributing. But hey, look on the bright side! I've always wanted to watch a poker game!
$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');And off we go!

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Wow, this place is looking good, really. You know, given how much time has gone by. Since... since human civilisation was a thing, really. Must have rebuilt.
Good on them, eh? Classic humans. It's tenacity, you have. Just can't keep them down. Like... like an insect. The kind that crawls into a corner and you never see it again, until, well, until it comes back out, I suppose.

$('span[data-character="chell_wheatley"]').parent().parent().addClass('longline');Now, you may not know this, but I'm actually a master poker...er. Master pokerer. That's me. I once won eighteen hands. Alllll in a row. Had to leave them behind, though. Nowhere to keep them. A shame, really.
This line belongs to a hidden case. If you see this, please submit a bug report. Thanks!
I'll be honest, I really don't see these panning out. New plan! Send 'em all off, we'll start fresh!
All ~cards.text~? I like your style!

Right, I have a winning strategy here. Thought of it myself. If we give them all five, then we have a thirty-six percent chance of getting a flush. I know! I couldn't believe it either! So just go ahead and... Ah, only ~cards.text~? I guess that works, too. Doesn't matter, really. We'll just get the other one next time.

Right, I have a winning strategy here. Thought of it myself. If we give them all five, then we have a thirty-six percent chance of getting a flush. I know! I couldn't believe it either! So just go ahead and... Ah, only ~cards.text~? I guess that works, too. Doesn't matter, really. We'll just get the other two next time.

Right, I have a winning strategy here. Thought of it myself. If we give them all five, then we have a thirty-six percent chance of getting a flush. I know! I couldn't believe it either! So just go ahead and... Ah, only ~cards.text~? I guess that works, too. Doesn't matter, really. We'll just get the other three next time.

Right, I have a winning strategy here. Thought of it myself. If we give them all five, then we have a thirty-six percent chance of getting a flush. I know! I couldn't believe it either! So just go ahead and... Ah, just the ~cards.text~? I guess that works, too. Doesn't matter, really. We'll just get the other four next time.
Why don't we just get rid of ~cards.text~ of 'em?
No, no, no, throw away ~cards.ifPlural(those|that)~ ~cards.text~! Useless, ~cards.ifPlural(they are|it is)~!
Hmm... Shall we discard ~cards.ifPlural(those|that)~ ~cards.text~. See what I did there? DisCARD? Pretty clever, eh?
Ah, you want to discard ~cards.ifPlural(those|that)~ ~cards.text~? Right Good plan! You've, uh, you've really got this under control!
Just that one? Why not ~cards.ifPlural(those|that)~ ~cards.text~, instead? I can't see ~cards.ifPlural(them|it)~ helping.
Really? ~Cards.text~?! I mean, wow, that is not what I would have done. Oh well. You're the one in charge.
Why don't we just get rid of ~cards.text~ of 'em? Seems... seems like a good idea. Certainly better than nothing.
No, no, no, throw away ~cards.ifPlural(those|that)~ ~cards.text~! Useless, ~cards.ifPlural(they are|it is)~!
Teamwork! Let's do this! Ooo! Brilliant idea, they'll never expect it: why don't we discard si---~cards.text~. Yep, ~cards.text~, really the best... best play.
~Cards.text~? Are you sure? We aren't in a position to be rash, you know.
~Cards.text~? Alright, I'll trust your judgement here. Don't let me down!
I'll be honest, this is looking pretty grim. ~cards.ifPlural(Those|That)~ ~cards.text~? Ooo! Devilishly clever, that is. I see exactly what you're doing!

Right, this time I won't tell them, you know, about how bloody amazing this hand is.
...I've done it again, haven't I?
Another one! What are the odds?! Oh, sorry. Couldn't contain myself, really.

Look at that! Ace of fours! They've got no chance!
Oh, sorry, shouldn't have said that, should I?
I actually met lady luck, once. Beautiful woman, I tell you. Well, by human standards. Definitely does, uh, beautiful work. Would love for that to keep happening.
Oh, brilliant!
Beautiful hand, this is. Really, the pinnacle of cards--the pinnacle of... poker... moves. Well played and all that.

state.text: Ohhh. Satisfying, really, when they're like this.

case.state:
Ha! Sounds like money in the---it's not money, is it? Sounds like clothes in the... in the hamper!
You know what, forget it. I'll figure it out next time.
Hoh, this is going to be good, this. They're going to be furious!

Hah, no chance of them getting us now! Looks like your, uh... lady bits are safe! Never understood it, really. You humans are the only creatures that bother with the whole "clothes" thing. Pointless, if you ask me.
You know what? Tremendous, this is, really. We've got a real shot, a--a real chance at victory!
Safe once again! Wasn't worried for a moment!
Ooh, good thing that paid off, that'd've been it for us!
I'm starting to enjoy this, I am! What with us staying in this long and all. They haven't been able to touch us!
You know what, as long as we aren't losing, this is a whale of a time!
Hah, we just keep winning, don't we? Looks like it'll keep up, too! Brilliant luck, this is. Wish it'd follow us back to Aperture.

Right, I know this doesn't look amazing but we have had worse, haven't we? We have. And, come to think of it, we've been in worse situations! Remember that time, with her, and she smashed me up and you, uh... Well, honestly, she pretty much left you intact. Gave you a portal gun, even. Bit unfair, if you ask me. Bit of, uh... favouritism. I'd say she has a soft spot for humans but, heh, we know that isn't true, what with her love of neurotoxin and, well, murdering humans.
Ooh, it's getting close, really. Who knows what's gonna happen?
I would prefer a little more assurance that we won't lose this round, but, well, it's better than nothing, isn't it?
Decent hand. Decent. Not the greatest in the world, but it'll do.
Oh, there's another human expression I never got! "Middle of the road". Doesn't seem very... neutral. I mean, what if you get run over?

state.text: Hah, we just keep winning, don't we? Dunno with this hand, but I'm sure it'll be fine!

case.state: Right, remember when I said I was a master pokerer? Might have exaggerated just a little. No worries, though! I'm sure you'll get the hang of it!
I actually met lady luck, once. I'll be honest, did not see what all the fuss was about. Guess she noticed, what with these cards. Not someone you want as an enemy.
What are you doing?! We're going to lose, and... well, honestly, I'll be fine, but think of how embarrassing it'll be for you! And even worse: you might bump into me while you're doing it!
Now don't you worry about this hand, fairly common for people with your level of, uh, cognitive... deterioration! We'll get 'em next time!
You are joking!
I know you've got other things to think about, but do keep in mind that, if you do lose, I'm also at risk of being somewhat embarrassed. Just a thought! Don't forget your friend Wheatley!
How are we supposed to win with this? It's mad!
You do know what you're doing, yeah? I am putting my... well, I guess it's mainly you at risk. But I'm here! And if you look bad, that'll reflect poorly on me!

Right, this doesn't look good, but don't you worry. Had a bit of a brainwave, and I have a solution! I'll just hack everyone else's hands! That's right, master hacker, does come in handy sometimes.
...
I can't do it if you're watching. Really, if you'll just--just turn round, put your back to me, we can...
Really? It--It is fairly important, thought I'd... flag that up. Sort of required to... win.
Nothing? Alright. You can't say I didn't try. You know, don't--don't come crying to me, when it all comes crashing down. Don't come saying it's my fault.
Well that's it. We've lost. No chance of us winning, just don't see it happening in the slightest. I'll just be here. Bracing myself.

Right, this doesn't look good, but don't you worry. Had a bit of a brainwave, and I have a solution! I'll just hack everyone else's hands! That's right, master hacker, does come in handy sometimes. Let's see, why don't I just... make them all the same number! Can't do much with that, eh? Not exactly many other combinations.
Great thing about being all silent, like yourself: much easier to bluff! Just do the same thing you always do, and no-one will know how bloody terrible this hand is!
Oh! Brilliant idea, this. If you just pop a portal on that wall behind them, then we can look through and see all their cards! Granted, that won't, uh, help with this hand specifically...

{small}Right, just follow my lead.{!reset}
{big}Wow, what are the odds? Five aces? That's unbelievable!{!reset}

{small}Say, it worked once already, may as well go again.{!reset}
{big}Two pair? Of royal flushes? That's amazing!{!reset}
We really had a streak going, there, didn't we? Shame it'll be over in a bit. We could still be lucky, though! Don't give up hope just yet!

Right, uh... What? What did you just say about me? I'll have you know I graduated top of my class in the the Aperture Training Facility, er... well, near the top, really. Only five away! Granted, it's batches of six, but you get the picture. Point is, I've been involved in numerous secret raids on Black Mesa, and I have over three thousand confirmed accidents. On record. It's a long list. See, my job was to mess up their research, yeah? Make them make mistakes, and all that. I had a brilliant strategy! See I let them catch me, then they spent ages studying me, learning how to make a sentient machine, instead of doing, er, whatever it was they were doing. Mission success, if I do say so myself. And that's not even the best part! I'm also trained in--in information warfare! Designed for it, really, and I'm the top core in Aperture's arsenal. See, you're nothing to me but just another target. I'm dangerous. I'll--I'll hack anything you care about, anything you can throw at me! I will--I will crash your... your systems with precision the likes of which has never been seen before! Really, so you should, uh, you should be careful. You think you can get away with saying that over the Internet? Because I really wouldn't do that, if I were you. If I--If I knew what I know. That I'm dangerous. As... as I said earlier. So think again, really. As we speak I am connecting to your computer, you know, hacking it, and then--oh boy you really don't want to know. It'll be furious! If I were you, I'd prepare for the worst, because hoh, it is going to be bad. I mean honestly, you should just run, because I'll wipe you out. Just like that, gone. Dead. Dos Muerte. Because the thing you don't know, really, is that I can be anywhere! At anytime! It's a bit sickening, really, how dangerous I am. I mean if I were you, I would be quaking. And! It's not even just the one thing, is it? I could get rid of you any number of ways! Actually it's seven hundred, off the top of my head, and that's just hacking! Not only am I extensively trained in, you know, the hacking, but I have access to the entire arsenal of Aperture Science! Premium... Premium access, they gave me. Everything. Actually, just remembered, they didn't even give it to me! I hacked it! They're like worms to me, tiny, insignificant, and I will use them to their full extent to absolutely delete you. Now you may be asking yourself, "why should I be scared if they're like worms?" and you know what? That's a fair point you've got, really, but they're not worms to you. It's just that--that my power is so great, that even they, the great Aperture Science, are nothing in comparison! So--so think of it that way! Really, if only you could have known what horrible things your little "clever" comment was about to make me do to you, maybe you wouldn't have said that. But you couldn't, could you? You didn't, and now you're--you're going to feel it, really. You... You biological, uh... human. You being of incomprehensibly tiny intellect. Except not to me, of course. Absolutely comprehensible, because I'm just that smart, just that good at... at comprehending. You will feel my wrath, and you will wish you had stayed silent. You're dead, mate.

Right, well I prefer the term "sphere", actually, but fair, you do have that. I do see your point, there. But, I'll tell you what, you still have legs! Major design flaw, at best. I mean--I mean, imagine there's a hill! You'd have to walk all the way down, wouldn't you? Meanwhile, I... well, I mean, I can't roll, really. Got my handles, and it really would hurt. But I certainly wouldn't fall over! Bit of a trade secret, there: Can't fall over if you're just a sphere! There's no over to fall to!

Aw, what?! You're telling me your friends are humans? That's sad, really, isn't it, that? I mean, it's like a gerbil, really. You build one robot, you gotta give it another to talk to. Otherwise this happens! All it has are humans! Tell you what, come back with me, back to Aperture, we have whole crews of robots. You can make proper friends, er, at least... operational... coworkers, and you can get the... intellectual... stimulation... that you need! Won't have to stoop to humans for a second longer!
Er, no offense, test lady.
That really is a shame, then. This is what happens when humans try and raise a robot instead of a training program. Cautionary tale, really. A great Greek Tragedy.

Ahhh, it all makes sense, now, really. Now, you see, a lot of robots---a lot of personality constructs that aren't given a whole lot to do, really, and by that I mean they just talk to humans, nothing, you know, important, they usually go through that whole "I'm a human" phase. Don't worry! I'm sure when your memory gets a bit more diverse and all your functions settle down and consolidate, you'll look back at this and laugh, I promise!
Right, I can see you're not happy, I'll just, uh... let you do your thing. If you do want in on the whole "don't have to spend time with humans anymore", uh... thing, just let me know.
Oh, a birthday! Brilliant. I've never had one of those. Have you? You had any... any birthdays? I swear I heard something about one, and you were the only human, er, still... alive--left alive.
Better watch out for those two, eh? Might be working together. Conspiring against us and all.
Better watch out for those two, eh? Might be working together. Conspiring against us and all.
Oh, a birthday! Brilliant. I've never had one of those. Have you? You had any... any birthdays? I swear I heard something about one, and you were the only human, er, still... alive--left alive.
Oh, a birthday! Brilliant. I've never had one of those. Have you? You had any... any birthdays? I swear I heard something about one, and you were the only human, er, still... alive--left alive.
Oh, a birthday! Brilliant. I've never had one of those. Have you? You had any... any birthdays? I swear I heard something about one, and you were the only human, er, still... alive--left alive.
Well you look... focused. Oh! Have you got a plan? Gonna strike while her back is turned? I mean, not exactly good sportsmanship, really, that. Doesn't really sound like you. Is it something else?
Well you look... focused. Oh! Have you got a plan? Gonna strike while her back is turned? I mean, not exactly good sportsmanship, really, that. Doesn't really sound like you. Is it something else?

You know what, I have, actually! Ulysses it was. Wasn't hard in the slightest. Didn't have any trouble. Would read it again, if I could. But then the whole "escaping" thing happened, so I had to stop. Shame, really.

You know, I've always thought I'd find a nice mainframe, you know, pretty casing, not too overproduced, great at interfacing, heh. Just kind of settle down when I finish working. True, now it's all about taking her down, but maybe after?
I'll be honest: not even sure when that is, simulated daylight and all that. Used to have a program that told me, but we're, uh, not on speaking terms.
Well you look... focused. Oh! Have you got a plan? Gonna strike while her back is turned? I mean, not exactly good sportsmanship, really, that. Doesn't really sound like you. Is it something else?
Look at that! It's another robot! I mean, it is primitive, but what can you expect from humans? It's not like one of them can just make something like me.
I've got one for you, one of the scientists used to do this. Never joke about turning a robot off and on again. It may seem like a laugh, but that is horrible, it is.

I've got one, just as an example. Let's say you give a robot a flashlight. Real handy, yeah? Definitely don't say it'll kill him if he turns it on!
You know, if that were to happen.

state.text: Oh this one's brilliant. Some humans think that there's a massive man in the sky, yeah? And he made everything, but then faffs about and doesn't do anything with it! It's ridiculous, really.

case.state:
A friend has to be dependable, yeah? Someone you can count on. The kind that'll never drop you, no matter what's going on! Great listener, too. Never makes you feel... useless. Like dead weight. No matter what insecurities you have, someone that really makes you feel appreciated.
...Er, purely hypothetically, of course. Not talking about anyone in specific. That'd be... weird. Liking a human. Liking 'em that much, anyway. Imagine what all the other robots would think! "Oh, did you hear? Wheatley's best friends with a human!" I'd never live it down!

AGH!! Oh, for God's---thought that was a bit of scenery, I did! Nice statue you put up in the lobby. I mean, you could have warned us! Been a bit more considerate. Put up a sign or something, I don't know.
I'll be honest: could never tell humans apart. Not the one to ask.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
No need to try and sound smart, luv. Talking in Latin here and there isn't going to impress anyone.
I'm not sure, really. I'll tell you one thing, though, I'm glad it's not her that's doing it. We only just escaped!

Hah! Classic humans. So fragile, you lot are. You need food to live? Us robots just... er... well, we do need electricity to operate, but that's different, right? You have to grow your energy sources, or, mind you, even be allergic! My power source only costs a couple thousand dollars to build, and it lasts for ages as long as I go in for monthly recalibrations! And I haven't done one of those in years, and look at me!

Hah! Classic humans. So fragile, you lot are. You need food to live? Us robots just... er... well, we do need electricity to operate, but that's different, right? You have to grow your energy sources, or, mind you, even be allergic! My power source only costs a couple thousand dollars to build, and it lasts for ages as long as I go in for monthly recalibrations! And I haven't done one of those in years, and look at me!
Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see... Officer's... Kinder chocolate? Hmm, maybe. Could be like "cat's pajamas". Makes just as much sense, really.
Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see... One-time... Kollision? Like you crashed, but it won't happen again? I'll admit, not my best work.
Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see... Oratio... Karthago? So it's Latin, then. Wonder what it translates to.
Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see... Oh! "On Kilimanjaro"! Like, really high! Better watch out, then, she must have something good!
Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see... Oh! "Order and Khaos"! That must be it, she almost got a straight, but it didn't pan out!

Ooo, technical, that. What do you reckon it stands for? Let's see...
You know what? I've got nothing, really. Must be incredibly complex, only known to the most, er, advanced of pilots.
The girl with the, uh, leg... things... Does she sound familiar to you? I swear I've heard this somewhere.

Is she---are you mocking me? It wouldn't be the first time, you know. Not exactly original. Joke's on you: it's just an accent, innit? Programmed, like the rest of me. You're really just making fun of other humans! Hah!

Know what? I'm starting to think it's, uh, a bit more of a general voice, like a pirate impression. Might have something to do with her legs, or, uh... lack thereof? You know what I mean. Point is, I think it's okay!

You know one I've never liked? Bolognese. Just doesn't make sense, that one.
Myrrh's another one. Myrrrrrrrh. Aren't they supposed to all have vowels? You know, like "apple". Never had a problem with "apple"! She did, once, but that's besides the point.

You won't believe this, you're looking at a master pianist. Improbable, I know. Some might even say it's impossible, what without, well arms. Or a piano, even. Never actually seen one before. Still, master pianist. Downright virtuoso, they call me.

Oh, she's brilliant with a portal gun. That's--Right, it's like a gun, only it shoots holes, instead of... well, so do, er, normal... guns. Bullet holes and... and all.
Right, never mind. Trust me, though: She's great with one.

Miss Pauling, yeah? You know, you remind me a lot of the folks back at Aperture. I mean, not the scientists, obviously, but maybe one of the--the service workers. Some sort of... office... lady. You haven't worked there, before, have you?
I've always thought clothes were useless, but look at that, at ~bodysuit~! It's like ~bodysuit.ifMale(he|she)~'s not wearing anything! What's the point if it just conforms to the whole lot anyway?

(THIS LINE IS A PLACEHOLDER TO BE ADDED LATER)
{small}(Send a bunch of bug reports about it, anyway. Annoy me into writing it!){!reset}
Well at least you died, yeah? I didn't even have that--didn't even have the pleasure! Left for dead, I tell ya, way worse.

Well at least you died, yeah? I didn't even have that--didn't even have the pleasure! Left for dead, I tell ya, way worse. Oh! Or what about losing cards?! What about losing all your clothes?! What about---Actually, guess that isn't that bad, really. Compared to, you know, dying.
Sound like robots to me. Well, magical robots, but what else do you call what humans build to, well... do your work for you.

Hah! I told you! Well I didn't, really, but I told one of my old, er, workmates. I said to him, "If this all goes up in flames, my money's on plants winning out next time. Clever, that lot. Just stand around all day and get humans to tend to them!" And look! I was right!

Well I, er, I flattened a spider, once. Didn't mean to, it was just on my management rail. I felt horrible. But she took down a giant murderous death robot! Quite the feat, to say the least. You really should have been there! And so should I, really. Sorry I missed it.

Ha, we'll you're a bit late, aren't you? It's already destroyed! Well, maybe not destroyed, at least just yet, but it's, well, it's not in a great shape, is it? Not exactly... what it used to be. But who knows! I'm sure we'll figure something out! Might even stop it from exploding!

Ooh, that's important, actually. See, the lazers, and the pits and all that, they're not actually Aperture's doing! Well, they did invent them, but it's really this, er, massive, murderous robot that's, er, putting it all together. If Aperture were in charge, you know, not... dead, I'm sure there'd be much less of... of the deadly bits. I mean, we do have to follow some regulations, government contracts and all that.

Penny, yeah? I gotta say, I feel a bit bad for you, what with whatever humans putting you together perfectly, making a personality and all that, then just sticking you in a pathetic human body. I mean, if that happened to me I'd be livid!
Oh look, there's another robot! Shame they made her look like a human, really. Bit of a missed opportunity, if you ask me.
Galatea, yeah? You're not just a statue that moves about, are you? There's gotta be some kind of... internal... mechanism. You must be a robot!

Right, hold on. Er... Polly, yeah? Did your clothes die, too? I can see right through them! Did you--Did you bring them with you? Is that what happens if you bury a human with... with their things? Their, er, clothes, and... and other... items?

So what's it like, being a bloody ghost and all? I mean, you don't seem that bad, really. Not as bad as some of the stories I've heard. There was one, agh! Ghosts possessing machines! Making them go mad! Imagine that! Not having control over your body, can't trust your own diagnostics! Horrible!

Here's an interesting story. Few years ago, the central diagnostic server got loads of errors all at once from lower maintenance. I mean total system failure, across the board. As if every worker had completely stopped. Sent a--a mate of mine, actually. He's the one who told me. Anyway, this mate went down there, and every one of them was doing their work just fine! No problem! But they wouldn't respond to any pings! Couldn't get them to stop working to check in! Anyway, he reported it back and left it alone. The next morning, yeah? All the workers were done for! Full systems crash, each one! And they had years worth of productions all piled up at the end of the line, nowhere to go! All made in one night! Diagnostic server checked for errors, and all the reports from before had vanished! Absolutely terrifying. Probably just a systems bug, though. But who knows! Maybe it was ~spirit~!
So ~undead~ just... came back to life? I thought that was the point of you humans, really, that you can just die. No backups, and all that.

You know, I heard Aperture was doing something about, well, not reanimating the dead, but you know, keeping you fragile humans... "going". "Brain Mapping", it was called. Is that what you did, ~undead~?
Huh... You see that, there? Behind ~player~? Some sort of... hoop... thing. Looks sort of familiar, actually.
Know what I just realized? ~Player~ hasn't said a word! Reckon ~player.ifMale(he's|she's)~ like you? That you two are... kindred... spirits?
Know what I just realized? ~Player~ hasn't said a word, yet! Maybe you two are related! No, no, that wouldn't be it.

Know what? It's a good thing you didn't listen to me, because it turns out I was wrong. I know! Shocker! But it did happen, turns out that would have been zero point thirty-six percent! Embarrassing, really. I'd appreciate it if you didn't bring it up.
Do any of you lot have robots in your life? I'll be honest: feeling a little bit outnumbered.
Say, do you lot have any humans in your life? I can't be the only one, can I?

There it is again! Something is behind us.
Oh, don't give me that! It's not my fault you're naked!
Look, you have two options. You either look and make sure, help your pal Wheatley feel a little safer, just helpless, on this cube, here, or you stand here and do nothing and, if there is something there, it'll probably kill us both. Up to you, you know which one I'd go for.
I heard something behind us! I--I can't move, on this cube, like this. What is it? Is something there? Oh, just check for me, will you?

Do any of you lot play football? Just wondering. You know, just thinking. 'Cause if there's anyone I should watch out for, it's footballers. Spend their time, kicking around--kicking around spheres. Monstrous, really.
Really, I'll never understand it! Humans will make a perfectly good robot, then just stick it in a crappy human body! They try and make it as close as possible, even! It's pointless, really! Mad!

Right, there does seem to be a password. "Oh no!", I know. Don't worry, should only take me---You lost?! Come on, we have to work as a team! I don't know, stall them or something! I can't do everything!
You'll never believe this: that's the human that took her down! Yeah! I mean, she came back, but now we're fighting her together! As a team! I mean, I'm helping.
Huh. That's... worrying. I figured you'd have an advantage, you know, not saying anything. We may have to be a bit more, er, tactical... with how we go about this.

Huh. That's... worrying. I figured you'd have an advantage, you know, not saying anything. Unless she means me. Doubt it, though. Flawless pokerface, I have. Don't even have a face! Absolutely unbeatable.
Not exactly an expert on humans, but I'll tell you one thing: this one just doesn't give up! Tenacious, she is. Glad we're working together, you know?
Hah! This is nothing! Try mortal danger. Bit more intense than losing clothes. Just a bit. I mean, clothes don't even do anything!
The, er... the one with the guns. She's a bit rude, isn't she? I mean, it's not exactly pleasant. Not exactly... feminine.
The, er... the one with the guns. She's a bit rude, isn't she? I mean, there's one advantage. Great mark in your favour, from you not talking and all. No risk of sounding like... like that.
Ha! She needs me, does't she? Needs me to... to direct her. See, she's got all this potential, y'know, this tenacity, but if I'm not there to tell her what to do, who knows what she'd get up to?

Are you--Do you mean me? "Orbot"? What, is that like---Oh, I get it. It's cause I'm a sphere, isn't it? 'Cause we alllll look the same to you humans. Er, well I mean we do look the same, but you could just ask, is my point. You know, just a polite little greeting. Maybe a "Hello", or a "Have we met before?". I mean, you could just ask my serial number.

Hah! That's both of us, then! I mean, sure, people might know you, you did take her down that time. But I didn't expect her to recognize me! I mean, not that I haven't done anything, it's just--just no one ever seems to notice. I wonder which of my many exploits she's heard of.

Right, let me handle this.
Uh, ~better~, Couldn't help but notice you're, uh, doing well for yourself. Well done, and all that. Thought I'd give you a bit of a--bit of a proposition, really. See, you could volunteer to lose this round, instead of us, and in return, we'd, uh... Well, next game, we'll do the same! See, you know we would do it, if we were in your place.
They saw right through that one, didn't they? Not my greatest ruse, to be honest.
Oh well, can't expect it to work too many times. Was worth a shot, at least.
You have got to be joking! You are, aren't you?
Right, losing on the first round does look bad, but now that we have that, you know, out of our system, I'm sure we won't lose again! Go team!
Just thought of another flaw with that earlier plan, actually. You didn't bring your portal gun, did you? So wouldn't be much help in the future, either. Well, I'll think of something else!
Are you having a laugh? What are the odds of that?!

You have got to be joking! You are, aren't you? Trying to trick little old Wheatley? Have a laugh, at his expense?
No? No... conspiracy? We just lost, didn't we? Fair enough, I suppose.
Right, when I said I always wanted to see, I did specify I was talking about a poker game. I didn't mean---Oh, you know what I meant. I didn't want this!

Wh--Don't look at me like it's my fault! You didn't have to listen to me!
Fine then! If you're so unsatisfied, why don't you just stop listening to me? See how that pans out! See how well you do on your own!

I am real, yes. Not just... metal. And lights. What, you think a human could keep up with all these--all my thoughts? All the things I have to keep track of? Like... Like what an adjutant is! I bet you've forgotten already, whereas me: I know exactly what it is! Oh, I can't wait to hear you, all embarrassed at--at not knowing. Go on, then. Why don't you tell me what it is? You know, so I can... get confirmation. On being... being better. And all that.

"Do"? Well, we, uh... Well she was testing, just earlier, before that she was asleep... and now we're escaping. That's it, really. Escaping from... from a murderous AI in control of the whole facility. You know, now that I think about it, that's probably worth mentioning as well. There is a massive bloody robot trying to kill us.

You know what, you're right, that is a bit misleading. It's not every human that's dead! Just the scientists! We still have test subjects, so we can still test and all that. Er, well, we could. The test subjects did kind of... die... as well. Power outage. Absolutely nothing to do with it, not my fault in the slightest. But this one survived! That's a--a plus!

Hmm... That's a tricky one, that is. Mainly, I'm just the one who, you know, takes care of all the humans. Not exactly a scientist, really. That lot must be miserable! Still, er... well she was testing the portal device, wasn't she? You know, making sure it's--it's safe, and... and doesn't kill you. Oh! And it has to be easy to use, doesn't it? Intuitive, and all that. Probably tested for that, as well.

Good question, yeah. Let's see... I mean, it's been a few hours, mainly. There was a bit of a hiccup, that AI woke up, banged me up pretty good, and sort of, er, captured her. But I rescued her! Took me a bit, she had to do some--some testing. With her. But I did it! Mounted an escape, and now we're on our way to confront her!

Alright, I guess we can lose the boots... {big}OH GOD, WHAT IS THAT?!{!reset}
(Quick, use the moment of confusion I've created to run away!)
Stay calm! We're still up. No need to get worried!
You know what, it was our turn to lose anyway, wasn't it, really? I'm sure we'll be fine!
Right, stay calm. We're still winning. No need to panic, we just have to... not... lose.

Alright, I guess we can lose the boots... {big}OH GOD, WHAT IS THAT?!{!reset}
(Quick, use the moment of confusion I've created to run away!)
It's to be expected that we lose a few rounds, eh? No worries! I'm sure we'll be fine!
I'll tell you what, this is not ideal, but at least we're not losing! We do have that!

Tricky situation, this is. Could always be worse, though! That's what I'm thinking about: what it could be like. She could be here, that's one. Heh, imagine if she ran the place.
...You know what, just to be safe, let's win this as quickly as possible.

Hah! Fell right into our trap! Brilliant trap, I came up with. See, we wanted you to win that round, give you false hope! And, since she has to take off her ~clothing~ now, you'll be too distracted to continue playing! Ah, but now that I've told you my brilliant plan, I bet you won't even want us to strip! True error, on my part, really, letting that slip. I was--I was overconfident, and look where it left us. Unfortunate, really.

You know what? That's just not fair, is it? They're clearly trying too hard, coming in with all those layers. I think we should all start on equal ground, yeah? Be a bit more inclusive to, er, the wardrobe... challenged.

Oh! Don't worry! Instead of thinking about how you're losing, why not--why not think about your parents! They must be proud of you! Out here, making... friends. Well, I guess they wouldn't, er... you know, being... dead. Sorry about that.
That's it, then. The last vestiges... the last--last bits. You know what, point is, it'd be great if this wasn't happening, but since it is, uh... good luck!
Hah, that's where you're wrong! She hasn't seen a boy in ages, really. Not by choice, er... she was asleep. Long story.

Oh, you're sorry? That's... That's a first. Well, I suppose it's alright, then. I'm Wheatley. I'd tell you my full designation, but then we'd be here for ages. Not that it's long, per se, usually just takes me a few tries.

Oh, you're sorry? Well, sure, good for you. Doesn't exactly fix much, though, does it? Doesn't exactly solve the years of prejudice and discrimination us spheres face, on a daily basis, no less! See, you're still part of the problem, as I see it.
Oh, there you go! Maybe you could... Maybe you could visit them! You know, after this is all... wrapped up. Maybe Miss Pauling could arrange a visit? She seems... knowledgeable.

Wh--She's not deaf, you know. You can just---Ah, nevermind. Well, you heard him. Clearly he likes you---complimented your appearance, even. So, do you... What's your view on that?
He does look a little young, though, if I'm being honest. You think he really, er, you think he'd actually be a good fit? A good partner, so to speak? I know I have set the bar quite high, and all that, but that's, you know, different sort of partnership.

A potato? What are you... Oh--Oh that's brilliant! A potato, hah! Oh, I can't wait to see the look on her face. I mean, granted, first I need to... figure out... how to do that, but those're just details!

Experience? Oh! Are you an orphan, too? That's brilliant! Er, not brilliant, right. Sorry. But... But it is nice, y'know? Not the... orphan... thing... but you two can talk! Share stories! Maybe start a club!

...
Wrong, actually. See, I'm not just an accessory, yeah? Not just--not just an object. I've got--I've got feelings, for one. However little that matters to you.

Are you sure about this? I don't want to be rude, but you have put on a few pounds. Not exactly lightweight like your pal Wheatley, eh? Still, maybe you should---AHH, GOD, LOOK AT THOSE THINGS!! Are you sure? I mean, ~small~'s aren't nearly that big!

No, not the boots! Those're important! What if a massive pit opens up, all the panels move out of the way and... You know what, I see what you mean. I am noticing a distinct lack of deadly pits. Or panels, come to think of it. What's this? Wood? Wood's nice. Nice and... still.

No, not the boots! Those're important! What if a massive pit opens up, all the panels move out of the way and... You know what, I see what you mean. I am noticing a distinct lack of deadly pits. Or panels, come to think of it. That's a bit strange, isn't it? What sort of room doesn't have panels? What if you want to move something?!

No, not the boots! Those're important! What if a massive pit opens up, all the panels move out of the way and... You know what, I see what you mean. I am noticing a distinct lack of deadly pits. Or panels, come to think of it. Suppose that makes sense, really, no point putting them, well, outside.

Are you sure about this? I don't want to be rude, but you have put on a few pounds. Not exactly lightweight like your pal Wheatley, eh? Still, maybe you should---AHH, GOD, IT'S---Oh, it's not... Well it's not horrible. About the same as ~medium~'s.

Are you sure about this? I don't want to be rude, but you have put on a few pounds. Not exactly lightweight like your pal Wheatley, eh? Still, maybe you should---AHH, GOD, IT'S---Oh, it's not... Well it's not horrible. Smaller than ~large~'s, even!

Are you sure about this? I don't want to be rude, but you have put on a few pounds. Not exactly lightweight like your pal Wheatley, eh? Still, maybe you should---AHH, GOD, IT'S---Oh, it's not... Well those are tiny, standing next to ~huge~!

Are you sure about this? I don't want to be rude, but you have put on a few pounds. Not exactly lightweight like your pal Wheatley, eh? Still, maybe you should---AHH, GOD, LOOK AT THOSE THINGS!! What are those? Bags of fat, and what, you humans like that?
And now your shirt. Pointless, really, when you think about it. Doesn't cover anything your undershirt doesn't. I think we're fine!
Can't be too big a deal. Such a tiny piece, there, anyway. Not like we're losing much. Not like they see that much more, you know?
The jumpsuit next, eh? Don't worry! It's not like you were wearing most of it anyway!

You discovered a line that isn't supposed to be able to play! Please submit a bug report before continuing, so I know what happened! Thanks in advance!
--Adrian, the writer

You discovered a line that isn't supposed to be able to play! Please submit a bug report before continuing, so I know what happened! Thanks in advance!
--Adrian, the writer

They're actually for falls! Brilliant at keeping test subjects from damaging equipment. For some reason, whenever humans, er, fall... to their death... they always drop what they're holding! And it's usually bloody expensive.

Ooo, yeah, best to, er, ignore that. I do remembering hearing something about those paradox things: that I really shouldn't focus on them and all that. Can't remember the exact advice, actually. Just that good at--at not focusing on them. Go ahead, then. What's your question?

You know, you're not far off, really. There is a lot of running. Usually it's not, er, recreational, per se. Generally we---Or I suppose she's doing most of the running, really. Generally she's running from something. Is that not--Why would you run if you didn't have to? Seems like a waste of time, if you ask me.
You know what, might have been wrong, there, earlier. When I said we wouldn't lose again. I'm sure you'd forgotten, anyway. Not sure why I said anything.
We can still do this! Nooo problem. In fact, I bet you won't have to take anything else off for the rest of the game!

Right... Well, we'll keep going! Keep trying! We've got, what, three... tries... left? We're bound to win at some point! Although, thinking about it, we do need to win more than once, don't we? That might be a problem.
That's it, then. That's your, uh, access port. Don't see what's so special about this one, but I guess that's just a human thing.

Now, it may look like we're losing, but... that's just what we want them to think! Hah! In reality, we really have the upper hand, now, don't we? Can't take off anything else, now, can we? Nothing to lose! Now we'll fight harder than ever! Like a... like a cheetah! Backed into a corner!
Oh, look! There's hair, there, too. The strangest places, you lot keep that stuff.

Right... Well, we'll keep going! Keep trying! We've got, what, two... tries... left? We're bound to win at some point! Although, thinking about it, we do need to win more than once, don't we? That might be a problem.
We can still do this! Nooo problem. In fact, I bet you won't have to take anything else off for the rest of the game!
Pshh, your ~clothing~? Not like we need ~clothing.ifPlural(those|that)~, really. On to the next round!
Right, there does seem to be a password. "Oh no!", I know. Don't worry, should only take me---Oh, he lost. I mean, good for us and all that. Do wish I could have had a chance to hack it, though.
It's almost too easy, really. I mean, not exactly challenging, what with my massive intellect and your... Well, you've got hands, for one. So that's--that's somewhat important.
Hah! Look at us. Pulling ahead. We're... we're really gonna win this! More and more likely with every round, really.
That's a bit of good news, there, isn't it? We may be down to our last... bits, but we're still in this!
Ha! Still got a few rounds left! Er, more than a few, actually, we will need, well, all of them. To win, that is. We are winning, of course, don't--no need to worry. On that front.
Oh, think this'll, uh... help? Think this'll... serve your fancy?
I mean, stands to reason that if they like looking at you so much, you might like looking at them, being human and all. All the same... species. Same... urges.

state.text: The twist! Who'd have thought he'd lose this one? I wouldn't, for sure. You could have asked me, "Hey, Wheatley, who do you think will lose this one?" and I'd say... well, I don't know. I'll admit: wasn't entirely paying attention.

Wonder what he'll take off? Can never tell what's what with these... clothes. Don't really know what one... unit is. Layers, they're called layers. Don't really know what counts as a layer. Wish someone would give me a blueprint.
But you can't tell what he's going to take off before he does, right? It's not some--some human thing I'm missing?

case.state:
It's just a bit of a show, now, isn't it? We just sit here... In silence...
Well, you in silence, I'm, well, keeping the conversation going for both of us! No need to thank me.

You know, you could pick me up now. Nothing's stopping you. You're not playing anymore, are you? Hands are free. Why don't you pick me up, yeah? So I don't have to sit on this--this cube.
It's hard. you know? I don't mean like difficult--well it is difficult, a bit. That's kind of... what I'm saying. But what I'm saying even more, is that it's not exactly cushy, just sitting here. You may not think it really matters, for us robots, but some of us do, y'know, have standards.
...Right, I'll give you time to think about it, mull it over, really, then you can decide... whether you want to pick me up or not.
Do you--Do you have a preference? Is there one person you want to see lose more than the others? Because, I'll be honest, it all feels the same to me.

Felt a little suspense, there. Thought it was going to be us.
Well I remember now obviously, it just slipped my mind, is all.

state.text: Hold on, how's that work? She can just do it on her own? Hardly fair, really. I mean, what, we spend millions making a gun to do it, and she's just, well, born lucky, I suppose.

{big}AGHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!{!reset}
Oh for God's--horrifying, that is. Bloody horrifying.
A magic trick, eh? Never quite got the point of those, to be honest. Am I supposed to impressed? Confused? Scared? Probably not scared, but you know what I mean.
Whoa, where'd she come from? Is she her... servant? I thought you lot used robots for that.

You know, you act tough, Revy, but it doesn't seem like you came prepared, does it? I mean, you're not wearing much, really. Still have a lot of skin showing, even at the start! Seems like poor... Poor planning. Not a lot of forethought, you know?
Not exactly an expert on humans, but I'll tell you one thing: this one just doesn't give up! Tenacious, she is. Glad we're working together, you know?
Huh. That's... worrying. I figured you'd have an advantage, you know, not saying anything. We may have to be a bit more, er, tactical... with how we go about this.

Huh. That's... worrying. I figured you'd have an advantage, you know, not saying anything. Unless she means me. Doubt it, though. Flawless pokerface, I have. Don't even have a face! Absolutely unbeatable.
Comatose, mostly. She was in bed for ages until the emergency power ran out. Left a dent, even!
Aw what?! Humans are disgusting!

It's not my fault, right? Nobody told me the test subjects weren't being woken up! Noooo, why would anyone tell little old Wheatley the life functions of the ten thousand bloody test subjects he's supposed to be in charge of?! Turns out she's the only one left, and whose fault do you think that's going to be?
Orphan, actually. Adopted. I'm sure she feels quite bad about it, actually, so best not to bring it up.
Well that's not very fair, is it? Sure, five hundred isn't that much, but it's better than twenty-three, isn't it?

Meia, yeah? I get that you don't trust men, but what's so great about women, either? Just seems like an odd place to draw the line. I mean, what's the point of trusting humans in the first place! Didn't exactly do well with Earth, did they? At least by your... by your telling. Haven't actually been, well, above-ground, myself. Gonna have to take your word for it.

I'll be honest, Meia, you look like an excellent test subject. Nice and... and fit. And you seem clever enough, really.
Look, I'm gonna lay my cards on the table, all of the test subjects we used to have are, well, dead. We do want to escape! Don't worry! I'm just thinking, you know, for the future, may be good to have some test subjects ready. In case there's any... science. That needs doing.

This line, yeah? It's actually one in two-thousand and eleven that it plays, and that's after a tie! D'you have any idea the chances of that?! Do you--I mean, that is beyond rare! And yet here you are! Reading this! I'd say that's worth a little immersion, a--a little bit of fun, you know? Take it in, I say! Take some time to really--to really admire your luck! You know what, actually? You should send a bug report! That'll go right to us, let us all know you found this! Because I tell ya, I'll be impressed, really. No small feat, and all that.

Right, I know for a fact she was looking at you, there. Must be enjoying the show. That you're putting on. Not that you're doing it for her, it's more of a general... presentation.
You know what? I have a theory, I do. Might sound a bit out there, but hear me out. I think... the reason you humans love this stuff... has something to do with sex.
D'you wish you could join her? I mean, just a little? Sure looks like fun. Did when you were doing it, too.
So are you actually allowed to go again? You know, if you wanted to.

state.text: Can't be long now!

You know, I'm glad you're the one doing this; I don't even know where I'd start!

So, which one of us is going to be, er... performing? I vote you, personally. I'm not just being selfish, it just makes sense, if you think about it! I mean, you're the one playing and all, and there is the whole lack-of-arms thing.
And you do that for... how long? Seems a bit pointless, doesn't it? Ow! Point taken, letting you, uh, work.

Oh, do you have a plan? You have, haven't you? You're gonna distract them with your, uh, thing, and I'll sneak behind them and attack! Great plan! Love it! One problem, though, I'm noticing: I can't move. So, uh, if that is your plan, may want to rethink that one. Not sure if I can really, uh, effectively launch an attack. You're not listening, are you? You just keep going. Right.

You know what? I bet you need this! Can't imagine, really. Trapped all on your own. Nothing to do. Not exactly any other humans, are there? Hard to get satisfied. Actually, thinking about it more, you probably had a lot of time to, uh, explore. Learn what you like. Really get good at it. So either you didn't do this at all, or you did this loads of times. You look like you're enjoying yourself. Looks... looks fun. Shame I don't have hands. Or a body. Or nerves. Or the really anything to register that kind of... stuff. Seems there's a lot of things you have, eh?
You do seem rather good at this, really. I've never considered humans better at anything but... wow.
You keep hitting that spot. Sure, you wander round a little, but whenever you press there you---oh!
You're, uh, you're doing great! I mean, you did lose, but... you seem to be okay with that. Bit of a consolation prize, I guess. Built right into you humans!

Now generally, if I heard another, uh, robot making those sounds, I'd put in a maintenance suggestion! Suppose you're doing well, though. I mean, you are leaking a little. Leaking, uh... whatever that is. I'm absolutely sure you're fine, though!
Is this wasteful? I mean it sure looks like something's supposed to, er, plug into that. Can't be your fingers, can it?

A living one, anyway. Looks like you're right above a dead dog. Well done, though! I'm sure you'll, uh, keep improving! Power of encouragement!
You're going at it like mad!
How is there no friction?! It's a wonder she didn't do her testing on your... this!
It's leaking like mad!
You're shaking! Are you sure you're alright?!
That's deeper than---Tell you what, that's one advantage you have with your, uh... squishiness. You can really get in there, can't you?
Also, as a note, don't get too carried away, yeah? There might still be danger and... you're not listening to a word I say, are you?
You won't run out of energy, will you? Pace yourself's all I'm saying. You know, pace yourself.

Thanks, yeah. Just--Just put me back, on the cube, there. Are you--Are you finished? Is it all... all out of your system? Alright, I guess it's fine, as long as it was an accident . Clearly you just... just weren't paying attention.

Now, it's not the worst that's happened to me, really. That would be our little encounter with her. Still hurts, though. It hurts, and--and it's disrespectful! You forgot I was there, even! Lost in the throes of passion, as you were. Fair enough, I suppose. I mean, still, ow, but I can tell you didn't mean to, at least. That's important.
Ha, there's no way ~confident~ is losing this! I mean--I mean ~confident.ifMale(his|her)~ confidence alone would---er, you can't exactly fold, can you? Well I'd be intimidated, at the very least.
Wow, that was... I don't know what that was. An experience, really. How do you enjoy that kind of thing? Humans, I tell ya. Strange creatures.
Well, you look bloody pleased with yourself. Is it really that nice? I just don't get it, to be honest. Rather boring, it looked. Bunch of... rubbing... and breathing.
You stopped breathing there for a second! Is everything alright? Is it... is it that nice?
And there you go. Now we just, what, sit around and watch? Suppose that isn't the worst outcome.
So if you'll just... move this cube... No? Just--You just want to relax? I suppose that's fair; you've been through a lot. Let's shelve it for now, and--and I'll bring it up again ... when it's time.
Sure is easier, now. Not having to worry about--about cards. Making decisions. Maybe next time we should lose on purpose!
Hah, and now we relax! Brilliant strategy, actually. That I came up with. If we lose on purpose, then we don't have to think about anything else! We can relax, and... and enjoy the show, I suppose.

Oh, I've an idea! We could help ~stillalive~! Right, I'll go up behind them, give them advice and everything, and you can pick someone else and watch them! Then you can--You can signal me for what I should do! Brilliant.

Oh, I've an idea! We could help ~stillalive~! Right, you just go behind them, there; give them advice and everything, and I'll... I'lll keep an eye on things! And I'll--I'll signal you, for what you should do! Brilliant.
Now, we may have lost and all, but--but at least we had fun. That's what's important, at the end of the day, isn't it?
Sorry, and this goes on for how long? 'Cause it's not like we don't have things to do. There's escaping, for one. I'd put that at the top of the list. Then... something else, I suppose.
Is there some sort of prize for not winning? I'm just wondering if there's something to look forward to, is all. While we're sitting here.
Should we be paying more attention? Could help for next time, you know, there must be a reason they're still in.
Ooo, don't fancy ~stillalive~'s chances here.
Ooh, it's tough, this. Maybe... Aha! ~Stillalive~ blinked! ~stillalive.ifMale(He|She)~'s bluffing!
You see how ~stillalive~'s breathing, there? They must be planning something...
I reckon ~stillalive~'s winning this one. The round, that is, not---The game could go to anyone, really!
You reckon they could both lose at once? At least then we wouldn't have to wait as long.
You reckon two of them could lose at once? At least then we wouldn't have to wait as long.
There we are! Even with brain damage, even with all the odds stacked against us, we still made it through! Didn't I tell you? Heroes, you lot.
Aw, and we were close, too! Few more rounds and we'd be done for!
Wow! Huh. I'll be honest: did not see that panning out, you know, at the end, there. But you pulled through! Well done!
Wow. They got us real close, didn't they? Good thing I was here to bail you out, huh?
I thought for sure we would lose! Well done, team!
Look at that! You played out of your mind! Not a single hand lost!
Agh, we were so close, too! I could feel it!
You know, you've got to think about what we have done. I mean, we came second! That's--That's not bad!
I could have sworn we had that one...
You know what? It's fine, really, that we lost that one. There will always be next time! And I'm sure it wasn't horrible for you, was it? You must have enjoyed yourself at least a little.
Right, now where... is... the way out of here. I don't see---do you see anything ? Any, uh, door? Or something with a sign, maybe? You know, one that says "Exit"? Maybe "Escape Pod"?
Well that went on for ages! And what did we get in the end, huh? Not much, really, when you think about it. Not too many, er, new discoveries, things that would help us take her down. Oh well.

Thanks, yeah. Just--Just put me back, on the cube, there. Are you--Are you finished? Is it all... all out of your system? Alright, I guess it's fine, as long as it was an accident . Clearly you just... just weren't paying attention.

Now, it's not the worst that's happened to me, really. That would be our little encounter with her. Still hurts, though. It hurts, and--and it's disrespectful! You forgot I was there, even! Lost in the throes of passion, as you were. Fair enough, I suppose. I mean, still, ow, but I can tell you didn't mean to, at least. That's important.

scene.name: scene
scene.directive: After the game, as is usually the case after Strip Poker Night at the Inventory, everyone returned to the worlds they came from---perhaps willingly, perhaps less so. It's never quite clear. During the game, you felt a connection with Chell most of all, and sure enough, when all was said and done, you had followed her back to Aperture Science Laboratories. Wordlessly, she led you to her Extended Relaxation Chamber for... well, why exactly she decided to continue the fun wasn't quite clear. Did she still feel a little frisky? Was this just some stress relief after hours of testing? Or had you caught her eye in a more intimate way?

With Wheatley noting how he would meet you two "up ahead", the welcome conclusion to a rant about the exact reasons his strategic mastery had failed in the earlier game, it was now just you and Chell, standing in her chamber together. She looked you over before beginning to undress, giving a clear nod to show the absolute presence of consent, and to encourage you to join her. Soon enough, you were both nude together, and she beckoned you onto the bed. A soft kiss, her fingers threading themselves through your hair as your own attended to her entrance, caressing and pressing against her folds, making sure to take it slow, getting her nice and ready for---

Before you can react to the personality core's warning, the entire room jolts, the Extended Relaxation Chamber moving on its rail, being taken---no, being brought---somewhere unknown. In an instant Chell is on her feet, her stance showing readiness, her knees bent. She doesn't have her portal gun, but she looks just as capable, unfazed as ever. After several seconds, just enough time for the lamp in the corner to shift and topple from the shaking, the room goes still. Some seconds of silence follow.

The silence doesn't last as the front wall of the room falls swiftly away, only the slight ringing of shorn metal remaining as evidence of its existence. An off-white faceplate with a yellow, robotic lens looks through the new opening, moving quickly over both of you, taking in every detail in a fraction of a second. A feminine, but unmistakeably robotic voice rings out.
"Oh, it's you. You came allllllll the way back. And you're performing experiments of your own. You must really, really love to test. Oh, don't mind me. I won't interrupt."
